body:
I need more details please!

Can you fill in the template you deleted and supply a log - thanks.

running linux ubuntu on Azure Batch

doesn't work (but did before update to 1.6.1 from 1.6.0)
/usr/bin/rclone copy --config temp_rclone.conf --fast-list --update --use-server-modtime --max-age 6h --progress --no-traverse  s3:processed/3 viadls:json-3/incoming/

 
 works:
/usr/bin/rclone sync --config temp_rclone.conf --fast-list --size-only --checkers=8 s3:processed/3 viadls:json-3/processed/

Error: 
RESPONSE 409: 409 Public access is not permitted on this storage account.
ERROR CODE: PublicAccessNotPermitted


That's about all I have time for as this has caused a lot of issues I have to go deal with (downgrades)
Can you post a redacted config file please?

[viadls]
type = azureblob
account = [account name]
key = [account key]

[s3]
type = s3
provider = AWS
access_key_id = [access key]
secret_access_key = [secret access key]
sse_kms_key_id = [key id]
region = us-west-1
location_constraint = us-west-1
acl = private
server_side_encryption = aws:kms
i have the same issue. backups worked for month, yesterday upgrade to 1.6.1 and the above issue arised (same azure config as above)

The error `PublicAccessNotPermitted` means rclone is trying to access the container without auth which is weird and not what is happening here when I try the same.

@wallina3 or @an-tex can you make me a log with the command failing and attach it here? Something like

    rclone lsf yourazureremote:container -vv --dump bodies --retries 1 --low-level-retries 1 --log-file issue-6645.log

Please redact the log file as necessary and attach it here.

If `rclone lsf` doesn't fail, then please find a command which does. If you are transferring data then change the command to `--dump headers` instead of `--dump bodies` otherwise the data will be in the log file.

Thank you.

Without a log file, I have no idea what is going on!

Hi all, we also implemented this new version v1.61.0.0 and we also have an ERROR CODE: PublicAccessNotPermitted.
It looks like it only happens using subfolders in an Azure container

[issue-6645.log](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/10285725/issue-6645.log)
@ncw here you go

for comparison, here's the same successful copy using 1.60.1
[issue-6645_1.60.1.log](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/10285731/issue-6645_1.60.1.log)

UPDATE:
sorry the previous 1.60.1 log was for the case where the test file already existed on the remote. here's another one where it's missing

[issue-6645_1.60.1_missing_file.log](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/10285760/issue-6645_1.60.1_missing_file.log)

and thanks a lot for looking into it so fast :)

@ncw . We agree that it is weird, because we tested version v1.61.0.0 on our test environment, and there it workfed fine. But in another environment it failed (with another storage account). This did work before placing this version.
When we restored the old version of rclone, it worked again.

rename.from: rclone copy is ignoring the config file and throwing authentication errors in 1.6.1.
rename.to: azureblob: is throwing "409 Public access is not permitted on this storage account" with v1.61.0

body:
I believe I've fixed this here https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6645-azureblob-container/v1.62.0-beta.6657.3d42ae02c.fix-6645-azureblob-container/ on branch [fix-6645-azureblob-container](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6645-azureblob-container)

Can you give it a try please?

```
    azureblob: fix "409 Public access is not permitted on this storage account"
    
    This error was caused by rclone supplying an empty
    `x-ms-blob-public-access:` header when creating a container for
    private access, rather than omitting it completely.
    
    This is a valid way of specifying containers should be private, but if
    the storage account has a no public data policy then it gives "409
    Public access is not permitted on this storage account".
    
    This patch fixes the problem by only supplying the header if the
    access is set.
```

PS I'm sure I posted this 2 hours ago but I don't see it - apologies if it turns out to be a duplicate!

Hi Nick,
I can confirm that on my system it is working with the updated Version:
**v1.62.0-beta.6657.3d42ae02c.fix-6645-azureblob-container**

I ran the command:
rclone copy -vv --config temp_rclone.conf --ignore-checksum --ignore-times awsnbu:commission2022/sales.csv sbdatalake:sbdatalake/reports/

Note: On the Azure Account the flag "**Blob public access**" must be set to disabled, otherwise the error will not occur

## Results:

# Version v1.61.0
RESPONSE 409: 409 Public access is not permitted on this storage account.
ERROR CODE: PublicAccessNotPermitted

# Version v1.62.0-beta.6657.3d42ae02c.fix-6645-azureblob-container
2022/12/23 00:34:42 INFO  : **sales.csv: Copied** (replaced existing)
2022/12/23 00:34:42 INFO  :
Transferred:            104 B / 104 B, 100%, 0 B/s, ETA -
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:        21.5s

Thanks a lot for the quick response. Greate support.
Thanks @nilsbuer for the report. I'll merge this for v1.61.1 now which I'll release today or tomorrow.

Hi Nick,
Thanks a lot.
I noticed that the guys from Achmea Insurance also participating in the rclone forum now.

Best regards ,
Nils
